titleStmt.title: The Longer Now of Ulysses: Digital Life After Analog Death
"proteus"

publicationStmt.publisher: "The Longer Now of Ulysses: Digital Life After Analog Death" published by David Carlton as part of the "Long Now of Ulysses" library exhibit, hosted, sponsored and produced by the University of Victoria, English 507 and English 520.

p.l: Comment ? Rich booty you brough back ; Le Tutu, five tattered numbers of
Pantalon Blanc et Culotte Rouge, a blue French telegram, curiosity to show :

l.q: The aunt thinks you killed your mother. That's why she won't.

p.l: Then here's a health to Mulligan's aunt
And I'll tell you the reason why.
She always kept things decent in

lb.l: His feet marched in sudden proud rhyth over the sand furrows, along

p.l: by the boulders of the south wall. He stared at them proudly, piled stone
mammoth skulls. Gold light on sea, on sand, on boulders. The sun is there,
the slender trees, the lemon houses.

lb.l: Paris rawly waking, crude sunlight on her lemon streets. Moist pith of

p.l: farls of bread, the froggreen wormwood, he matin incense, court the air.
Belluomo rises from the bed of his wife's lover's wife, the kerchiefed housewife
is astir, a saucer of acetic acid in her hands. In Rodot's Yvonne and Madeleine
newmake there tumbled beauties, shattering with gold teeth chaussons of
pastry, their mouths yellowed with the pus of flan bréton. Faces of Paris men
